creator: dab18@izhnet.ru
text:
Created attachment 24738
patch to adding xhtml title scanning

mod_autoindex only extract titles from "text/html" (.html, .htm) files, not "application/xhtml+xml" (.xhtml)

creator: nick@webthing.com
text:
Do you have a use case for this - where the XHTML is coming from?

There are three places in the source where it tests for "text/html", but you've only added "application/xhtml+xml" to one of them.  Is this an oversight, or are there good reasons why one code path is relevant and the others aren't?

(In reply to comment #1)
> Do you have a use case for this - where the XHTML is coming from?
static XHTML files with ".xhtml" extension.
apache determines their mime-type using default /etc/mime.types as "application/xhtml+xml".

apache directory listing output:
Name             Last modified     Size Description
Parent Directory - 
document1.html   19-Dec-2009 17:56 23K  here document title from title tag
document2.xhtml  19-Dec-2009 18:12 3.1K -nothing-

files with ".xhtml" extension lose description.

> There are three places in the source where it tests for "text/html", but you've
> only added "application/xhtml+xml" to one of them.  Is this an oversight, or
> are there good reasons why one code path is relevant and the others aren't?

my mistake. i forgot about ReadmeName/HeaderName files with ".xhtml" extension.
